<title level="1" right="Spell 3" pfs="Standard">
[Soothing Blossoms](/Spells.aspx?ID=999)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=125" />
<trait label="Wood" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=508" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 129 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Area** 10-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

Blossoms grow from the ground in a small area, soothing away afflictions and persistent pains and harm. When any creature in that area rolls a successful save against a [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126) or [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46) effect, it gets a critical success instead. The blossoms grant assisted recovery to everyone in the area to end their [persistent damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29), both when the spell is cast and at the start of each of your turns.

 Once the duration ends, the flowers lose their magical effect, but a few of them might survive in the area as long as they can naturally. This spell doesn't give a benefit on a save against an affliction unless the stage lasts 10 minutes or less.
name: Soothing Blossoms
